de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.utilities.optionhandling.constraints

Class ListSizeConstraint

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.utilities.optionhandling.constraints.ListSizeConstraint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ParameterConstraint<Object>

    public class ListSizeConstraint
extends Object
implements ParameterConstraint<Object>
    Represents a list-size parameter constraint. The size of the list parameter ( ListParameter) to be tested has to be equal to the specified list size constraint. FIXME: Unfortunately, we cannot have good type safety anymore right now.
    Author:
    Steffi Wanka

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The list size constraint.

    • Method Detail

      • test

        public void test(Object t)
          throws ParameterException
        Checks if the list parameter fulfills the size constraint. If not, a parameter exception is thrown.
        Specified by:
        test in interface ParameterConstraint<Object>
        Parameters:
        t - Value to be checked whether or not it fulfills the underlying parameter constraint.
        Throws:
        ParameterException, - if the size of the list parameter given is not equal to the list size constraint specified.
        ParameterException - if the parameter to be tested does not fulfill the parameter constraint

        Returns a description of this constraint.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
